title: Strange 'copy package'
description: When performing the 'copy package' operation in the 'org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui' package, the resulting package in the destination workspace is named 'ui' instead of 'org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui'.
OB: After the 'copy package' operation, the package in the destination workspace is named 'ui'.
EB: After the 'copy package' operation, the package in the destination workspace should be named 'org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui'.
SR:
1. Open 'jdt.ui3' in the Eclipse IDE
2. Select the package 'org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui'
3. Right click on the package and choose 'Copy'
4. Navigate to the destination workspace
5. Right click on the destination package explorer and choose 'Paste'
